Node.definition: = process by which an action is repeated or continued
= man; ◄ from the land of Uz (עוּץ) ► main character of book of Job
literally: to lift up (words); hence: = action by which humans utter certain words

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

= state in which humans and deities are alive and well, ◄ which, for humans, requires the presence of air to breathe and food to eat; ≈ life is regarded as more than a mere physical condition; in many cases it includes health, strength, and some degree of prosperity
with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= a situation where one party has a dispute with another party, and is looking for a legal ruling in which they receive what they consider to be rightfully theirs
= deity; ◄ of Israel; traditionally: Almighty One; better: All sufficient One (= the One every good and perfect gift comes from); ≈ another name for Israel's God

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood

= the air that is taken in and expelled through the lungs by humans and animals, which makes them live, and which distinguishes them from inanimate objects like idols; ≈ regarded as coming from God; sometimes God is depicted as a breathing being as well
= the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= part of the body projecting above the mouth on the face of a person or animal, containing the two nostrils
= particle marking an oath or a similar strongly worded statement

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= the state of being or acting in an unjust or morally evil way
= the fleshy organ in the mouth, used for tasting, licking, swallowing, and (in the case of humans) speaking
= particle marking an oath or a similar strongly worded statement
= action by which humans utter words with the focus on what is said
= the state in which something false is described or spoken about as true, so that others believe it to be truth
= exclamation expressing a strong conclusion, rejecting the event to which it refers to as inappropriate behavior
= particle marking an oath or a similar strongly worded statement
= causative action by which humans or deities declare (other) humans to conform to an accepted code of behavior

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
particle linking two events; = relation indicating that event X ends at the time of occurrence or completion of event Y

Node.gloss: to expire|to breathe one's last|to perish
Node.definition: = process by which a human being breathes his last breath, ◄ either as a result of a natural cause or of an unnatural cause, ► resulting in death

= pattern of behavior of humans or deities that is in accordance to the requirements of the divine law and generally aimed at establishing or restoring this pattern as a standard, which in certain cases requires a victory over evil and results in prosperity and happiness

Node.gloss: to hold on to|to devote oneself to|to persist in|to retain|to obtain
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities are actively involved in a certain event

Node.gloss: to reproach|to taunt|to insult|to defy|to blaspheme
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans make an effort to arouse an emotion of shame in (other) humans or deities; ◄ by their words or actions
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
literally: days; hence: = an unspecified amount of time
= person who has a conflict with someone else and acts accordingly

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

= state in which humans experience a desire for something to happen, together with a degree of confidence that this desire will be fulfilled through the intervention of someone else; as a result, they are willing to defer taking action for some time
= state in which humans are impure in character, without regard or respect for God
= process by which someone's life comes to an end, as if being cut off from the community of the living
= the highest God, creator of heaven and earth

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation
with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= a process by which humans go through extremely difficult circumstances, resulting in severe anxiety, ◄ as if one were confined to a narrow and cramped space from which there is no escape

= particle linking two events and denoting that X takes places in order to establish whether Y is true or not; X is often elided, which turns the remainder of the phrase into a question, which is often rhetorical
= deity; ◄ of Israel; traditionally: Almighty One; better: All sufficient One (= the One every good and perfect gift comes from); ≈ another name for Israel's God
= action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another
= the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
literally: at all time; = a long stretch of time, without any interruptions
= causative action by which humans or deities cause (other) humans to acquire knowledge, a skill, or a certain type of behavior

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
literally: hand; hence: = action by which humans or deities exert strength and power
with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= deity; ◄ of Israel; traditionally: Almighty One; better: All sufficient One (= the One every good and perfect gift comes from); ≈ another name for Israel's God
= causative action by which humans refrain from sharing information with others
= referent to a group of male (and female) participants that are addressed if a discourse
= process by which humans gain knowledge and wisdom; ◄ from what they have observed
= state in which a condition does not serve any purpose
= action by which humans are engaged in activities that do not serve any purpose
= something that happens to someone; ◄ whether or not as recompense for what he/she has done
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality
with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= state in which a person is a strong and powerful enemy, who is thinks high of himself and is prone to violence, and usually does not fear God
= deity; ◄ of Israel; traditionally: Almighty One; better: All sufficient One (= the One every good and perfect gift comes from); ≈ another name for Israel's God
= marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
= action by which humans are engaged in an armed conflict with other humans, accompanied by deeds of aggression
= one's children including their respective offspring ◄ literally referred to as those who come forth from someone
= process by which someone's desire for food is fulfilled
= a staple food ◄ made from a dough of water and either wheat or barley then baked; ► together with water considered the very basis of life, often used to refer to food in general
= a person who was able to flee from danger
= a condition that leads to death, like a deadly disease or a wave of violence

Node.gloss: to be buried > to be killed by death
Node.definition: literally: to be buried by death; hence: = to be killed, probably by a fatal epidemic disease

= woman whose husband has died and therefore has difficulty caring for herself; ≈ regarded as one of the weaker members of the society and should therefore receive special care, together with the aliens, the fatherless, and other people who are poor

Node.gloss: to cry|to weep|to lament|to mourn|to bewail
Node.definition: = action by which someone express his/her grief or sorrow by shedding tears, crying loud and making appropriate gestures, ◄ because of some personal or national calamity, or for a dead person
= marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

Node.gloss: to heap up|to pile up|to store up
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans pile up large quantities of objects in one place
= the loose natural substance of the earth's surface
= silver, usually in the form of small unstamped pieces that had to be weighed in order to determine their value; after the exile, people in Israel started using coins

= stiff tenacious earth; ► material of which bricks, pottery, and even man himself is made; ≈ buildings made with this material are regarded as relatively weak as opposed to buildings made of stone; therefore it is also seen as relatively worthless material
= causative action by which humans or deities cause an object to be firmly located in a certain place
= generic designation for any article of clothing
= causative action by which humans or deities cause an object to be firmly located in a certain place
= state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior
= action by which humans put on clothes or ornaments
= silver, usually in the form of small unstamped pieces that had to be weighed in order to determine their value; after the exile, people in Israel started using coins
= state in which humans are not held responsible for actions committed in the past or for future commitments
= process by which humans receive a portion of an object (or range of objects) that has been divided
= action by which humans perform construction activities, either in order to erect a new building or to rebuild or repair an existing one

= smallish brown or gray moth that lays eggs in clothing or other cloth; eggs hatch into very small caterpillars, which feed on the fibers; ◄ Tineidae family, probably Tineola biselliella; ≈ symbols of decay, ruin, and slow destruction

= construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction

= a shelter, ◄ made of fragile materials such as leaves and branches, ► for the purpose of protection from rain and sun for both humans and animals; used by people who needed a temporary shelter, such as nomads, soldiers, and farm workers in the field; ≈ by extension, figuratively God's protection over his people, God's shelter for himself; also a metaphor for Jerusalem, the dwelling of God's people; also by extension, a place where ferocious animals can hide in order to attack someone
= causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them
= action by which humans or deities carefully observe an object or event for a longer period of time

= state or action by which a human being or animal is in or assumes a horizontal position; ► in order to rest, sleep, or have sex with someone, or because of being unable to stand up as a result of weakness or death; ≈ sometimes associated with security

Node.gloss: to gather|to assemble|to accumulate|to harvest|to do again
Node.definition: = to bring together people, animals, plants, and/or other things from different places for a common purpose|read יסף (יסף)

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices
literally: to open (one's) eyes; hence: = process by which humans wake up from sleep or death

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant

literally: to overtake; hence: = process by which events that humans have been expecting or dreading finally take place, ◄ as if they had been pursuing them for some time and ultimately caught up with them
= something that instills an intense and overpowering fear in someone else; ≈ often associated with death and darkness
= the time of day that is characterized by darkness; ≈ associated with sleep, fear, evil, and hardship

= action by which humans secretly take possession of objects belonging to someone else, and sometimes even of other humans, without permission or legal right and usually without intending to return it
= process by which a strong wind blows, ► causing destruction and inspiring fear; ≈ often associated with the appearance and intervention of God and used as a symbol of warfare and hardship

Node.gloss: to take up|to lift up|to carry
Node.definition: literally: to lift up; hence: = action by which humans take hold of objects with their hands, with the intention of holding them or bringing them to another location
= process by which an object vanishes from existence
= state in which an event is relatively low in intensity ◄ as if being merciful
literally: hand; hence: = action by which humans or deities exert strength and power
= action by which humans move to another place in haste, ► in order to escape from a dangerous situation
= action by which humans move to another place in haste, ► in order to escape from a dangerous situation
literally: to strike (one's) palms (together); hence: = action by which humans express their anger and disgust by striking their hands together

Node.gloss: to clap (one's) hands (out of anger, frustration, disgust)
Node.definition: exact meaning unsure, possibly: = to strike the palm of one's hand against the other hand ≈ as a symbol of anger, frustration, or disgust
